reviewText: Denise Austin is my all-time favorite exercise instructor.  Whenever I get in a slump, not wanting to exercise, etc., I can always count on her encouraging, energizing, positive attitude to get back in the mode of exercising regularly.  Also, when I use Denise's dvds, I never hurt my back or anything like I have with other dvd's.  Also, I need variety and fun or I know I'll just eventually quit.  I know, maybe that's not a very good attitude, but it's a reality.  At least I know myself enough to know this is the truth and to take measures to get around it.  Anyway, Denise has a great variety of fun and versatile workouts so that no matter what, there's something that works for the moment.  She also gives lot's of good advice in her workouts and has a great mix/balance of weight training and aerobic exercises.  If you feel like you don't have energy for more than 10 minutes or if you feel like getting an intense 1 hour workout, you can find this with Denise's workouts.  Thanks for helping me stay on track, Denise!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have to laugh at some of the comments made about Denise Austin's vocal cues and motivation style... I met her once, and she is EXACTLY the same in person - I found her extremely genuine and likable.  Plus, anyone who can get me off the couch and exercising using weights and a stability ball is pure genius!I'm not advanced enough to give a critical review of her programs and methodology, but I AM impressed that she moves quickly from one exercise to the next without creating a lot of muscle fatigue. Sticking with a program is the greatest goal anyone should have when beginning an exercise regime.  With Denise Austin's Shrink Your Female Fat Zones it's doable - even at 46 years old.  I think she's great, but the stabilty ball takes a little getting used to.
summary: Anything that gets ME exercising is a good thing!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This 40 minute workout is solid. It's got exercise to work all the muscles in your body but I don't think it's for an advanced exerciser. When I first started working out I used this dvd and it was fabulous. I really saw results and I thought it was tough. Now a days, however, it's a little too easy for me. So if you want a really solid workout as a beginner or want something tried and true for an easier workout, this dvd is a great choice.I like it because it isn't separate 10 minute routines focusing on one body region. It's all integrated into one flowing routine which goes between arms, legs and abs. That is one thing I do like about this dvd. Sometimes you don't want to "target tone" you just want a great solid workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of several Denise Austin workouts that I own. It really does target the "female fat zones". It is two different workouts (weights and balance ball),but they are filmed all together, so you can either do one at a time, or do both. It doesn't switch between them for the whole workout. I don't even have a balance ball, but I love the weight exercises, so I do those regularly.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I went from sedentary to relatively toned primarily through the virtues of this routine, which I have been doing now for about 6 weeks.  The DVD bills itself as containing two separate routines--weights and exercise ball--but as other reviewers have noted, it's really one workout you can break into two.  The warm-up is clumped with the weights; the cool-down is with the ball.  It would have been nice if they had taken advantage of DVD technology as they do in Denise Austin's Personal Training System to allow users to stretch & cool-down with either routine.  I had intended to break them into two, but gave in and simply do it all at once.  If you choose to do the ball portion only, you might want to do a few warm-up stretches of your own before you start.  Cool-down after the weights may not be necessary for you, unless it leaves your muscles feeling tight.Many people find Denise Austin grating.  She talks nonstop.  Some of this inane chatter ("That's right; you've got it!"--which I still find cheering even though I know she can't possibly know), but some of it is pretty informative.  She tells what each exercise is meant to work and discusses proper form--though not always early enough in the exercise.  Sometimes we'll be halfway through something, and she'll suddenly say, "Exhale when you lift up."  This can be a bit of a problem when you first start doing the routine, but as you get used to it, you'll start anticipating these belated reminders.The best part about this workout is how fluidly Austin moves from one part of the body to another.  It keeps the cumulative impact of the exercises from overwhelming you--you don't exhaust your arms, for instance, by doing them in one fell swoop.  They get a bit of a rest while you work the legs and the abs before you come back.I love this DVD.  I'm still finding parts of it challenging, though I can now do all the exercies, but I can see an incredible difference in the muscle tone in my body.  I am now varying it with Denise Austin's Personal Training System for variety, but I can say with all confidence that whether my female fat zones have shrunk or not, they're definitely better sculpted.Equipment required: 3 to 8 lb. handweights & a stability ball.  Be sure to get the right size: the one I started with was too big for my 5'2" frame, and I eventually had to replace it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Denise Austin provides a great workout.  However, you need to have several pieces of equipment to make it happen:  a mat, an exercise ball, and handweights.  You can combine the 2 twenty-minute workouts into 1 forty-minute workout if you like.  The only problem is that Denise talks too much and her voice becomes shrill after a while.  If you can let that slide, this is a good workout.

reviewText: This 40-minute workout (divided into two 20-minute segments) provides a thorough, total-body toning/sculpting workout. Using dumbells and a stability ball, it effectively targets every part of the arms, shoulders, back, abs, buttocks and thighs - and includes both standing and lying exercises. I felt that none of the exercises performed in this workout were a waste of time, and all of the moves were effective and could be felt throughout. The warm up consists of Yoga inspired moves and stretches, and the cool down is performed on the stability ball. Denise also offers clear instruction and attention to form.I absolutely love the teal-green and aqua-blue set in this video. It's three-dimensional, artistically designed and beautifully detailed. The soft lighting and rich color are also very soothing on the eyes.Overall, this is a fanstastic body-sculpting video where not a moment is wasted. I would consider this to be a basic intermediate level, which can be easily progressed to by beginners. It can be effectively incorporated into a tight schedule or done on lighter days for those who are more accustomed to lengthier, highly advanced workouts.This is an essential video in my collection and definitely one of my favorites.
summary: Fantastic, total-body toning workout - one of Denise's best!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was disappointed when I bought this tape.  I'm an avid exercise nut and I loved Denise's Ultimate Fat Burner. I guess I expected something similiar because of the title.  This would be a great workout for someone just getting into workouts as she has some good exercises here, just doesn't do enough of them to do anything for those who are more advanced.  I used heavier weights to get a little more from it but this is one video that is only used when I'm not feeling terrific or when I first start working out in the fall(I run in the warmer months and save the videos for winter).  Some of the ball exercises are fun and even a little challenging, you just don't do enough repetitions.

I wanted a different workout, not more of the same.  I didn't realize you need a stability ball for part of the exercises and I haven't gotten around to buying one yet.  I think I will try the 2nd workout when I get my ball, but I was dissapointed with the other exercises.

reviewText: Let me give you the quick version  - I bought this DVD in December of 2004, and have advanced so much because of it.  I have since lost 30 pounds, and have gained a firm and strong body (the right way!)  I know that her chatty style isn't for everyone, but she kept me coming back for more.  The moves are very simple, but do the job right - especially for beginners.  It gives you an all around workout without feeling  frustrated at the end and feeling like giving up.  The exercises were tough for me at first, but stick with it -  after awhile you will be able to do this with EASE.  I work out daily 4-5 week with DVD's much tougher than this one now, but I will always love this one for giving me my start!!  Hope this helps... and remember, if you are not feeling like working out - just think of how you will feel the day after when you didn't - it is so worth it!
summary: This DVD is what got me started on the fast track to fitness!!!

She keeps you going through the whole video by giving you interesting advise.  She also coaches on some of the moves; I found that good too.  I am a new Mom.  This video is helping me get back into shape.  I can also do it throughout the day with my baby since it is broken up into two segments.  My baby smiles along with me.  I highly recommend this one.

reviewText: ok she is really hyper and super smiley, but this dvd is actually really good.  It covers everything, so it makes a really good full body workout with out lots of equipment and time.  I've had this dvd for a good while now and it's still a decent challenge everytime.  It's fast paced and she does challenge you by mixing up easy and hard moves. I don't own any of her other workouts but I think this one really does the job .

reviewText: I should preface this by saying that I'm not a big fan of Denise Austin's peppy "you can do it!" attitude (although I think she has gotten better over the years). But I do think the two workouts on this DVD are very good, especially for advanced beginners. I think it's a little too fast paced for people who don't know what they're doing (whenever you're handling weights, good form is a must, and that takes a little time to learn. That goes double when you're using a stability ball). As someone who writes about fitness, I do want to say that the ending stretches are a little too short, and that you should continue to stretch for a few more minutes after you're done. My biggest complaint with this DVD is the programming - it would have been nice if they had set it up so that you could do each routine separately and included a stretch at the end of each 20-minute segment. The exercises themselves, however, are really good.

reviewText: Denise Austin's "Shrink Your Female Fat Zones" is an effective tape that can be split into two 20 minute sessions or one 40 minute workout.Women are often told that to prevent bone loss, we should workout with weights, but many tapes on the market are overwhelming. They use very heavy weights, are very long, lack clear directions or are just plain boring.Denise's tape gives you a simple workout that you can do 3-4 times a week to build strength, preserve bone density and get toned.The first section is a simple 20 minute light weight routine. You will do a few pushups, lat rows, light ab work, bicep work etc. Very simple. No jumping around. Clear direction. The second session adds in the balance ball. The ball is not included in the tape but is sold by places like Wal-mart for under $20.00. With the ball you work your core, legs and more.Pick one or both workouts depending on your mood and needs.The setting is a studio with a calm background, one that will not date in the future. Denise leads the exercises with a small group of exercisers behind her, following her directions. It would have been nice if Denise had included some older exercisers, but she didnt. The music is relaxing. Though Denise is her usual chatty self she is not overbearing. Denise uses the same set of weights throughout the workout which could be a drawback for those who like to vary their weights as there is not a lot of time to change poundage.My goal is not to be a fitness buff, but to be healthy, strong and slender. I don't want to kill myself working out but recognize that in addition to aerobic activity (which this tape is not) I need weight bearing activity. This tape is just the perfect fit for my needs.
summary: Quick lil' tape to get you toned!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an excellent workout! If you really want to "shrink your female fat zones" this is a great way to do it! Denise is encouraging, makes the routine fun with some dance steps, but nothing too difficult - especially for those of us with two left feet! The workout is hard enough, but not too hard. Denise offers less difficult moves and advanced moves for the more intense parts of the workout...no one gets left out. You can keep moving and making progress with every workout.  I purchased 3 of Denise's DVD's to keep my routine "spiced up", no boredom. Also, I recommend reading Denise's book "Fit and Fabulous After 40"...a most excellent read for those of us either approaching forty or beyond.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is my favorite toning workout with Denise Austin.  After looking at different workout DVDs from other fitness experts, Denise is my favorite.  I love her energy and enthusiasm shown in all of her workouts.For this DVD, you'll need light weights (3-8 lbs probably) and a stability ball.  The workout is broken into two segments, one with weights and the other with the ball & weights.  You'll get to do a lot of great exercises that tone your tummy, arms, legs, and butt.I like to alternate between cardio and strength training/toning workouts while always remembering to stetch too.  Using Denise's DVDs, I have lost about twenty pounds.  I use to weigh about 150 and now weigh about 130.  It took several months to loose the weight and my goal is to be more toned and healthy.  I also highly recommend Denise's indoor walk DVD.  I can't always do all of the moves either in Denise's DVDs, but I really enjoy them.I give this DVD four instead of five stars because of several reasons.  1) You get to do stretching in this DVD but I feel there's a lack of stretching for your arms with the amount of lifting weights you do.  2) The two twenty minute sections run into in each and there's no pause between the two, so you may be confused when first doing this workout if you just want to do the first segment.
summary: A Great Toning Workout with Denise Austin!

Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay, let me start by saying that this was my first ever Denise Austin video.  After reading about how much she annoys so many people I had no idea what to expect.  Initially she's almost laughable but it seems she calms down after a while and I found her motivating and extremely genuine.  She seems to sincerely care about what she does and how it can help you, she really reminds me of a kindergarten teacher.The routine was great.  As many other reviewers have pointed out, it is not a cardiovascular workout (nor does it claim to be).  However, for someone who is as out of shape as me, it is quite a workout in itself.  I found myself working up a bit of a sweat and my muscles were shaking at some points because they were working so hard.  I did the full 40-minute segment which seems to be the most effective.  There is a short break in between the "just weights 20-minutes" and the "stability ball and weights 20-minutes" where you could pause and come back to later if you wanted.One of the things I really like about the routine Denise walks you through is that she alternates from legs, to abs, to arms, etc.  She doesn't have you working one muscle-group too much at one time.  It seems like she covers most the areas I'd be concerned about and explains why she does each exercise and which areas you're targeting during the workout, which I liked a lot too.  She continually motivates you and tells you to hang in there and lets you know how much longer which I also found extremely helpful.The one downfall is that the transition time is very quick and I would sometimes miss the first 1-2 reps trying to catch-up.  However, I think after I do this DVD a couple more times I'll be right in line with her.  With that, its probably better in the long-run so you don't feel the routine moves to slowly.I highly recommend to anyone looking for an overall strengthening video concentrating on all the areas we are looking to tone.
Title: N/A
